reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent two nights in a suite at Koder House, and enjoyed the visit very much. The hotel is a former private home of one of Fort Cochin's leading Jewish Families (sadly now mostly gone), but at least their lovely home remains and is open for travellers. Our suite was huge, with a lovely four-poster bed, large dressing room and en suite bath with separate shower and jacuzzi bath. The restaurant was good, but the menu never changed, nor did there seem to be a special of the day (shame), so after two lunches and dinners, we pined for something different. There is a tiny pool just off the restaurant - seems to be a bit of a gimick to me, as we never saw anyone use it. I think the space would be far better having an outdoor area for dining! The tables/chairs in the dining room are huge...but tables are limited, so many walk-in guests cannot be accommodated. With so many new guest houses being opened in the area, Koder House will come under some pressure to add amenities. There is a small spa in the hotel, which offered good treatments at great prices. Staff and service were excellent. One major point - the hotel lacks a bar, and asking for pre-dinner drinks anywhere but in the restaurant proved to be a bit of an undertaking...and they are not licensed for spirits - just wine and beer. A nice touch was the delicious slice of chocolate & orange cake that was left by the bed nightly, with a sweet note wishing you a good night on your pillow. If I returned to Fort Cochin, I would not hesitate to stay at Koder House again.

reviews.text: Koder house is not a boutique hotel in the conventional sense. It is not a hip, minimalist, elegant hotel with attitude. It is an old, wooden house built by one of the leading Jewish families in Fort Cochin and purchased two years ago by Mrs and Mrs Vicky Raj who restored it and tried to keep it looking as it had in the 19th century. I personally found that very welcome. But if you want something more contemporary than the Malabar or the hotel next to Koder House (I think it is called Harbour View) would be better. The Raj's ordered wonderful high, wooden beds with really comfy mattresses and traditional looking light fixtures for the bedrooms. They also put in new bathrooms with jacuzzi and shower and a small outdoor pool where the garage had been. The effect is really a simple, old fashioned one. The rooms are huge and the suites have a vast dressing area. But please note that this is an old house so you hear will footsteps from the floor above. If you mind, then make sure you take a room on the top floor. It's a very personal, intimate hotel with attentive service. We enjoyed all kinds of nice touches: brownies and candy bars and mints on the bed each night, bed tea each morning, a good selection of local papers at reception, broad band internet on the top floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic and we were able to walk almost every where though we lazily took a car to Jewtown. The staff are polite and reticent but very able. They arranged priuvate boats for sunset cruises (750 rupees an hour for two hours) backwater cruises (750 per person for three hours) airport transfers and made restaurant reservations for us. Of all the places we ate, our favorite was the seafood restaurant (called Fort Cochin) at the Casino Hotel but it was a bit 20 minute drive to get there. (it has a great gift shop and Mrs Raj can tell you where the big branch of Fab India is)
reviews.title: Perfect!
Romantic Koder House
reviews.text: We also liked eating at the open air fish places across the street and in the hotel--though the breakfasts were nothing special. Best of all are the Rajs. They are lovely people and very helpful and knowledgable. We really felt like we were staying with family and it was sad to say goodbye. They are planning to develop two more properties--one on a tea plantation and one at the beach so I know we will be back to see them.
Firstly let me suggest that you visit Kochi in September - not only is monsoon over and the weather lovely, the hotel prices are way way lower - we only paid 70 pounds for our room at Koder House.

description: Welcome to Koder House. Koder House is a three-story heritage boutique hotel opposite the beach at Fort Kochi, Kerala, India. Until recently, it belonged to the most illustrious Cochin Jewish family, the Koders. This House had been a host to Presidents, Prime Ministers, Viceroys, Ambassadors, Nobel Laureates, Hollywood Directors and prominent dignitaries. This dwelling also finds a prominent place on Intach's list of heritage sites, and a visit to Fort Kochi is considered to be incomplete without a visit to this historic monument.
